verses.verse: ((A prophecy against Moab.) ) The (Read Isa. 13:1.) burden of Moab. Surely (The chief city, whereby the whole country was meant.) Ar of Moab was destroyed, and brought to silence in a night: surely Kir of Moab was destroyed, and brought to silence in a night.

(The Moabites shall flee to their idols for succor, but it shall be too late.) He shall go up to the Temple, and to Dibon to the high places to weep: for (Which were cites of Moab.) Nebo and for Medeba shall Moab howl: upon all (For as in the west parts the people used to let their hair grow long, when they mourned, so in the East part they cut it off.) their heads shall be baldness, and every beard shaven.
In their streets shall they be girded with sackcloth: on the tops of their houses, and in their streets everyone shall howl, and come down with weeping.
And Heshbon shall cry, and Elealeh: their voice shall be heard unto Jahaz: therefore the warriors of Moab shall shout: the soul of everyone shall lament in himself.

Mine (The Prophet speaketh this in the person of the Moabites: or as one that felt the great judgment of God that God should come upon them.) heart shall cry for Moab: his fugitives shall flee unto Zoar, (Meaning, that it was a city that ever lived in pleasure, and never felt sorrow.) an heifer of three years old: for they shall go up with weeping by the mounting up of Luhith: and by the way of Horonaim they (He describeth the miserable dissipation and flight of the Moabites.) shall raise up a cry of destruction.
For the waters of Nimrim shall be dried up: therefore the grass is withered, the herbs consumed, and there was no green herb.
Therefore what every man hath left, and their substance shall they bear to the (To hide themselves, and their goods there.) brook of the willows.
For the cry went round about the borders of Moab, and the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the skriking thereof unto Beer Elim,

Because the waters of Dimon shall be full (Of them that are slain.) of blood: for I will bring more upon Dimon, even lions (So that by no means they should escape the hand of God: thus will God punish the enemies of his Church.) upon him that escapeth of Moab, and to the remnant of the land.
